result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bernardo Mireles Garcia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Bernardo  Mireles Garcia, appeared with Attorney John Charles Bachman.  Susan Rascon sworn as interpreter. Agreement reached on all cases, This case dismissed and read-in to 15CF85

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Bachman  Defendant acknowledges receipt of the Information, complaint was read by DA by request of the defendant, defendant entered a NOT GUILTY plea to all counts on the information and misdemeanor cases.

Pre-trial conference at 09-08-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 10-08-2015 01:20 pm.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Bernardo Mireles Garcia, appeared from video from Clark County Jail with Attorney John Charles Bachman appearing in court.  The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 09:50 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Bernardo Mireles Garcia
Current: 509 N 2nd St, Abbotsford, WI 54405 United States  (Effective: 07-13-2015)
Prior: 409 N 6th St, Abbotsford, WI 54405

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.

Court Commission Sautebin appeared by telephone; No Court reporter present;  ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail.   Susan Rascon appeared by telephone as interpreter. Bond of $1000.00 set with no alcohol provision.
Defendant's notice of hearing-no forwarding address available
District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;   A  bench warrant  will be requested  on the defendants failure to appear.
